author: Bill A

text: The "Rave" was most likely started because of how JRPGs work -- you have the "now entering battle mode" animation, and then a panning view of the battlefield, perhaps a few words exchanged as the characters appear on the battlefield....and THEN the battle starts. The music is usually timed so that the "IT IS ON" starts playing just as you gain control of your first character.

author: Vaan

text: I think it is something like that as well. That is why I prefer the other ending, as in that ending Yuri's still alive and thus leaves it open for him to find some way to get Karen back, provided he finds a way to restore his soul.
author: Piisuke

text: It's like his body dies, but his soul goes back in time. I think that at least.
author: TrulySilentLie

text: You sure he goes back in time, or do you think he dies? After all, Alice is already dead. As for the paradox, it will only be there, as soon as Karen is born in Germany, which  means there's still time to get her out of there. With all the crazy shit that's been in the games, anything can happen, including Yuri getting his soul back. I am not expecting SH4 either, but its wishful thinking. I do have all games though, incl Koudelka.
author: Piisuke

text: In the good ending, he goes back in time to relive his memories. In the bad ending, he doesn't forget his memories, they are destroyed, along with his soul. Also, whichever ending they choose, the paradox will still be there, which might be why they left Yuri completely, just had some of the characters left. And there will probably not be any more shadow hearts games. Better to play them all again, starting with: Koudelka
author: TrulySilentLie

text:
Very true, but in one of the endings, Yuri goes back to be with Alice, in the other, he forgets his memory, which can still be restored.

Considering it would be a time paradox if Karen would be Yuri's mother, considering Karen would also be born around that time, I highly doubt, if there's ever a Shadow Hearts 4, that they'd get away with that story.
author: Piisuke

text: But the ending for SH2, wether it was the good or the bad, Karin did meet with Yuri's dad right? I thought she did at least.
author: TrulySilentLie

text:
I'm only calling people liars if they make up stories too farfetched to be believable, or simply claim things without backing them up.

Aside, Yuri's element has always been dark, it never changed. You just want Killer to be Yuri too much that you'd even go as far as claiming to be family.
author: Piisuke

text:
I like to believ she settled with his father, because that was the only way she was going to be with Yuri. Yuri says it in the game that his mother always cried when she looked at him, because she still loved Yuri.

As for the bad endings, not necessarily. SH2 took the bad ending from SH1, I am not sure what ending SH3 took. I personally hope the bad ending is chosen, as that, at least leaves Karen into the frame. Anyway, they don't automatically pick the bad ending, just SH2 as far as I know.
author: Piisuke

text: @Piisuke  would say that maybe she fell in love with his father, because of how he reminded her of Yuri... Anyway, so it really is the bad endings that lead to the next game? Then how do you explain the bad ending of Koudelka? Just asking...
author: TrulySilentLie

text: @dark3samus Uuuurm *CROAK* XD
author: Vordox

text: Nice beat.
author: Blinker 182

text:
(Continued from last reply)
I'm sorry if I offended you in any way,but I'm telling the truth and if you don't believe me,OK. But just be cool about it man,don't go calling people liars.

Oh, and P.S.:
On the Japanese version of the game, when you fight with Killer the first time, he's Fire, but when you fight him as Malice Killer  in The Gate, his element is Dark.
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: If Yuri and Killer aren't related, fine by me.I'm just telling you my point of view and Hirota's.I'm not forcing you to believe me.And I was just commenting;I don't think I have to SHOW you proof of anything.I know that you're thinking "Of course he's pissed, that shows that you really aren't related",but how would you feel if someone insisted on calling you a liar? (Continued on next reply)
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text:
It is easy to say that. Lemmie guess, you don't have proof you're related to said person either?

There is no hint in the game that Yuri and Killer are related. Yay, they look similar... apart from that they have a different haircolour and Yuri's element is Dark and not Fire, which Killer has.
author: Piisuke

text: I don't expect you to believe me. I get that a lot *laughs*. But if what you want is a written source, then I really can't help you there. I'm just telling you Hirota's point of view, based on what he's heard on the crew and his own opinion (at least that's what he told me). We got to talking when I went for a visit in Osaka and he really didn't tell me much. I just met him at that time and Japanese people aren't really that open when it comes to first time encounters.
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: Well, OK. Good enough. I guess you can say that the story has a lot of ways that you can interpret it. It's good to know every opinion and point of view from different players around the world.
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: Oh yeah, of course I believe that. Now give me a source where it is written by the person himself.
author: Piisuke

text:
No, not really. She fell in love with Yuri, but Yuri didn't was in love with Alice, who kept coming back from the dead, the greedy woman she is.
Karin loved Yuri so much, that all she wanted to be was at Yuri's side when the world was being destroyed. Because Yuri wanted to be somewhere else, Karin ended being his mother and later on die, due to that attack on his house.
author: Piisuke

text: Karin loves Yuri. She tells him, and it's not even necessary cause' it even shows throughout the game. But if you think about it carefully, she really loved him like a mother loves her child. She didn't really know that, of course.
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: I'm cousin to Yoshitaka Hirota. That's my source.
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: I have played all the games, hence I said the ending of SH2 was horrible. Alice is dead, get over it. Now, Karen who loved Yuri so much is forced into her being his mother. What a pain. The burden of loving your son as if he was your lover. Remember when Yuri sat on the bench and said he was named after his mother's first lover? Oh the cruelty. Man, what a horrible, horrible ending to a great game.
author: Piisuke

text: As far as I remember, Killer is unrelated to Yuri. They simply look alike. Please give me a source.
author: Piisuke

text: (Last reply, don't get anxious!)Unfortunately, Yuri took a wrong path and became the bad guy in SH3, known as Killer. So if you see, it's a cool storyline. I'm not saying that I liked the fact that they changed the main character, but seeing it from the good side, Yuri's still in the game. Please comment about my opinion. Thank You!
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: (Reply continued). She becomes his wife and they have Yuri as their son. Karin changes her name to Anne (Anastasia changed her legal papers, legally naming her Anne and a Russian). People that have played SH2 until the end know this. And in SH3, the story continues because what really died was Yuri's counsciousness and soul; this left in the world a body with no memory at all. (Continued in the next and last reply).
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: I personally think you're wrong. You see, every Shadow Hearts game has 2 endings (good and bad), right? But here's the thing: the real endings are the bad ones. In SH1, Alice dies and the story in the second game continues with that. In SH2, Yuri dies and Karin goes into the past and meets with Yuri's father. (Continued in my next reply).
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: You HAVE to play the first 2 Shadow Hearts games to fully understand the storyline. Also, be sure to watch the Shadow Hearts 2 ending completely (including the scene after the credits roll).
author: Alejandro Karkerovia

text: The ending was horrible. What a joke. Karen was humiliated.

text:
They certainly passed it off that way in the sequel. In the game itself, they were pretty explicit about calling it the Creator God of Judeo-Christian mythology.

My guess is that it was supposed to be the Demiurge (the false, imperfect creator deity) that is referred to in the more unorthodox branches of said mythology.
